title: [BUG] Model registry plugin registration fails due to circular dependencies since entrypoint registration happens on module import

labels.name: Acknowledged
labels.description: This issue has been read and acknowledged by the MLflow admins.

labels.name: area/model-registry
labels.description: Model registry, model registry APIs, and the fluent client calls for model registry

body:
Thank you for submitting an issue. Please refer to our [issue policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md) for additional information about bug reports. For help with debugging your code, please refer to [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/mlflow).

**Please fill in this bug report template to ensure a timely and thorough response.**

### Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages bug fix contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute a fix for this bug to the MLflow code base?

- [x] Yes. I can contribute a fix for this bug independently.
- [ ] Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**:
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**:
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: PyPI
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.19.0
- **Python version**: 3.9

### Describe the problem

Model registry plugin registration can fail due to circular dependencies.
The plugin entrypoint registration happens during the `mlflow.tracking.registry` module import where mlflow modules are not fully loaded yet. When the discovered plugin module starts importing mlflow, that import fails due to already bein in process of importing mlflow.

The solution would be to make entrypoint registration lazy. In general, doing significant or complex work on module initialization is discouraged.

### Code to reproduce issue

1. Create a Model Registry plugin that does `from mlflow.pyfunc import scoring_server`
2. Run `mlflow`
3. Receive error: `Failure attempting to register store for scheme "google_cloud": cannot import name 'MlflowClient' from partially initialized module 'mlflow.tracking.client' (most likely due to a circular import) (/usr/local/google/home/avolkov/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/client.py)`

### Other info / logs
```
$ mlflow
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/google/home/avolkov/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/registry.py", line 55, in register_entrypoints
    self.register(entrypoint.name, entrypoint.load())
  File "/usr/local/google/home/avolkov/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/entrypoints.py", line 82, in load
    mod = import_module(self.module_name)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/importlib/__init__.py", line 127, in import_module
    return _bootstrap._gcd_import(name[level:], package, level)
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1030, in _gcd_import
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1007, in _find_and_load
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 972, in _find_and_load_unlocked
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 228, in _call_with_frames_removed
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1030, in _gcd_import
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1007, in _find_and_load
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 986, in _find_and_load_unlocked
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 680, in _load_unlocked
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap_external>", line 790, in exec_module
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 228, in _call_with_frames_removed
  File "/usr/local/google/home/avolkov/_projects/google_cloud_mlflow/google_cloud_mlflow/__init__.py", line 1, in <module>
    from .mlflow_model_deployment_plugin_for_google_cloud_vertex_ai import *
  File "/usr/local/google/home/avolkov/_projects/google_cloud_mlflow/google_cloud_mlflow/mlflow_model_deployment_plugin_for_google_cloud_vertex_ai.py", line 13, in <module>
    from . import _mlflow_model_gcp_deployment_utils as vertex_utils
  File "/usr/local/google/home/avolkov/_projects/google_cloud_mlflow/google_cloud_mlflow/_mlflow_model_gcp_deployment_utils.py", line 42, in <module>
    from mlflow.pyfunc import scoring_server
  File "/usr/local/google/home/avolkov/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/mlflow/pyfunc/scoring_server/__init__.py", line 42, in <module>
    from mlflow.server.handlers import catch_mlflow_exception
  File "/usr/local/google/home/avolkov/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/mlflow/server/__init__.py", line 8, in <module>
    from mlflow.server import handlers
  File "/usr/local/google/home/avolkov/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/mlflow/server/handlers.py", line 17, in <module>
    from mlflow.projects._project_spec import MLPROJECT_FILE_NAME
  File "/usr/local/google/home/avolkov/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/mlflow/projects/__init__.py", line 9, in <module>
    import mlflow.projects.databricks
  File "/usr/local/google/home/avolkov/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/mlflow/projects/databricks.py", line 17, in <module>
    from mlflow.projects.utils import MLFLOW_LOCAL_BACKEND_RUN_ID_CONFIG
  File "/usr/local/google/home/avolkov/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/mlflow/projects/utils.py", line 17, in <module>
    from mlflow.tracking import fluent
  File "/usr/local/google/home/avolkov/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/fluent.py", line 16, in <module>
    from mlflow.tracking.client import MlflowClient
ImportError: cannot import name 'MlflowClient' from partially initialized module 'mlflow.tracking.client' (most likely due to a circular import) (/usr/local/google/home/avolkov/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/client.py)
/usr/local/google/home/avolkov/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/_model_registry/utils.py:148: UserWarning: Failure attempting to register store for scheme "google_cloud": cannot import name 'MlflowClient' from partially initialized module 'mlflow.tracking.client' (most likely due to a circular import) (/usr/local/google/home/avolkov/.local/lib/python3.9/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/client.py)
```


### What component(s), interfaces, languages, and integrations does this bug affect?
Components 
- [ ] `area/artifacts`: Artifact stores and artifact logging
- [ ] `area/build`: Build and test infrastructure for MLflow
- [ ] `area/docs`: MLflow documentation pages
- [ ] `area/examples`: Example code
- [x] `area/model-registry`: Model Registry service, APIs, and the fluent client calls for Model Registry
- [ ] `area/models`: MLmodel format, model serialization/deserialization, flavors
- [ ] `area/projects`: MLproject format, project running backends
- [ ] `area/scoring`: MLflow Model server, model deployment tools, Spark UDFs
- [ ] `area/server-infra`: MLflow Tracking server backend
- [ ] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging

Interface 
- [ ] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server
- [ ] `area/docker`: Docker use across MLflow's components, such as MLflow Projects and MLflow Models
- [ ] `area/sqlalchemy`: Use of SQLAlchemy in the Tracking Service or Model Registry
- [ ] `area/windows`: Windows support

Language 
- [ ] `language/r`: R APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/java`: Java APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/new`: Proposals for new client languages

Integrations
- [ ] `integrations/azure`: Azure and Azure ML integrations
- [ ] `integrations/sagemaker`: SageMaker integrations
- [ ] `integrations/databricks`: Databricks integrations
